meanings.definition: To gather or assemble (people, troops, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The farmer was mustering his sheep for the evening.
meanings.sent2: The team mustered their strength before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The children were mustering their toys for a pretend battle.
meanings.sent4: She mustered all her courage to speak up in class.
meanings.sent5: The students mustered their focus for the upcoming exam.

meanings.definition: The act of assembling or gathering together.
meanings.sent1: The mustering of the troops was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The mustering of evidence took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The mustering of ingredients for the cake was chaotic but fun.
meanings.sent4: The mustering of clouds signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The mustering of support from the community was heartwarming.
